creditline: Lent by Bob Ulrich and Jill Dahlin
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: carved single foot with cup in shape of head attached to black base; Mount L1.6 MS
text: Palm wine is a popular festive drink in Central Africa.  Many people such as the Kuba, Lele, Pende and Wongo favored the use of beautifully carved wooden cups to drink their palm wine.  Many were covered with intricate geometric patterns while others were carved in the shape of objects, human figures or heads.  These cups were objects of prestige used by and associated with important individuals.
title: Palm Wine Cup
